column4: i've just noted that kernel panic error, and it's: kernel panic: not syncing unable to mount root on unknown-block (3,3)
my root in grub.conf points to /dev/hda3 in my new kernel entry, which is the same as the default kernels
any ideas what i might have left out of the kernel?
IDE support?
its either IDE support, or ext2/3 support that's missing, probably
definately have filesystem stuff. any ideas what ide modules are needed?
ide-disk at least

remember, they need to be built into the kernel, not as modules, unless you're going to try and work out initrd stuff, but i find its generally easier to build the ide/fs stuff into the kernel *anyway* even if using initrd
yeah thats in there too
the other thing that can cause it... is if the kernel is trying to use 'accelerated IDE' drivers, but they're modules
never heard of accelerated ide
its the stuff that enables UDMA, ie the drivers like 'piix'
righto, i'll take a look thanks
those drivers vary based on your chipset, so you have to be careful to enable the right one (or just enable them all, there are only like 10 or so, and they're not huge)
look at lsmod on a working boot :)
the ide driver will be mentioned as a dependancy of ide_core
i get this for usb_core:  usb_storage,ide_cd,ide_generic,ide_disk,piix
then looks like you're using the intel chipset drivers
cool, i'll give it a go. i had via82 drivers in there, do you think including both is causing the error?
unlikely, to be honest
i wouldn't have thought so
ok cool.i'll have another go. thanks for your help, v useful
